intro: Stoebe gomphrenoides, commonly known as rough blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as prairies and woodland edges. Its ecological importance includes providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for various insects and wildlife.
